channel.title: Designing a Dialogue Tree
channel.description:
Okay, so I started working on a simpler way to implement dialogues between Players and Npcs. I've got most of the nitty-gritty done, I'm just trying to determine which of the following ways of "tracking" the dialogue would be best. I've narrowed it down to either single-step notation, or dot notation.
Here's the example of the single step:
[ol][li](next: 2)Npc - "Help I've fallen and I can't get up!"[/li] [li](next: 3)Player - "What happened?"[/li] [li](next: 4)Npc - "What do you mean? I just told you! I've fallen and I can't get up! Go into the chest over there and grab my replacement hip!" There would be an option screen here(4):[/li] [li](next: 6)Option: Okay, Hold on![/li] [li](next: 8)Option: Sorry, but you really should have invested in Life Alert.[/li] [li](next: 7)Npc - Thank you so much! Here take this[/li] [li]You go some hard candy... Great...[/li] [li](next: -1 (or end of dialogue)) Bastard![/li][/ol]
As you can see, it's messy. You can [b]kind of[/b] see a logical order, but it seems like there would be a better way.
This is an example of the dot notation:
[ol][li](next: 2)Npc - "Help I've fallen and I can't get up!"[/li] [li](next: 3)Player - "What happened?"[/li] [li](next: 4)Npc - "What do you mean? I just told you! I've fallen and I can't get up! Go into the chest over there and grab my replacement hip!"[/li] [li]There would be an option screen here: [list type=decimal] [li](next: 4.1.1) Option: Okay, Hold on! [list type=decimal] [li](next: -1 (or end of dialogue)) You go some hard candy... Great...[/li] [/list] [/li] [li](next: 4.2.1) Option: Sorry, but you really should have invested in Life Alert. [list type=decimal] [li](next: -1 (or end of dialogue)) Npc - Bastard![/li] [/list][/li] [/list][/li][/ol]
This one is much more logical, but it may get to be confusing with longer dialogues (7.4.1.1.8.6.2)
So which do you think would be the better choice?

item.title: Designing a Dialogue Tree
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Graham:

imho the second form is better, it’s the way I’m going to implement it in Apollo.

Yeah, it seemed like the most logical way to do it. Now I’m just trying to figure out what would be the best way to “describe” where you are in the tree. At first I was thinking about just using a String, but then I would have to str.split(".") to get the absolute location. My next thought was to have a “parent id” for each node. So in XML it would look something like

<tree>
    <node parent="-1" id="0" next="1">
        <line>blah</line>
        <line>blah</line>
        <line>blah</line>
    </node>
</tree>

And then just recursively step through until the parent id is -1. But that brought up more issues in terms of structure.
